contextId.information: insects that fly together in large groups. People fear them because they can eat up all the leaves in gardens and on trees. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
small insects with poisonous stingers on their tails. Their sting is extremely painful and the pain lasts a long time. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

Why they will wear sackcloth can be made explicit. AT: "wearing rough mourning clothes" or "they will wear scratchy clothes to show that they are very sad" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]] and (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]]) )
a tool with a curved blade used for cutting grass, grain, and vines (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
beautiful and valuable white beads. They are formed inside the shell of a certain kind of small animal that lives in the ocean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

If your language does not divide the day into 24 hours, you may need to use a more general expression. AT: "for a very short time" or "for a very small part of a day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

This is soft, strong cloth made from the fine string that silkworms make when they make their cocoons. AT: "expensive cloth" or "fine cloth" or "beautiful cloth" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

a beautiful hard, white material that people get from the tusks or teeth of very large animals such as elephants or walruses. AT: "tusks" or "valuable animal teeth" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

beautiful and valuable white beads. They are formed inside the shell of a certain kind of small animal that lives in the ocean. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:17:03|17:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
This is a valuable stone. Jasper may have been clear like glass or crystal. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:01|4:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

These are valuable stones. Jasper may have been clear like glass or crystal, and carnelian may have been red. Emeralds are green. See how you translated these in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:01|4:3]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

beautiful and valuable white beads. They are formed inside the shell of a certain kind of small animal that lives in the ocean. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:17:03|17:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])
